author: mrmitch
title: Flimsy set - but the pilot is cool!
review: The worst Jack Stone set we own, but we needed a plane and you can never have enough people to play with, rescue or put in jail. Inexpensive set around 4 US dollars or less. If you miss this one no big deal.

author: BobaFett2
title: Ugly as it gets
review:
This set is plain awful. Not only is it way too juniorized, but it also has

Box/Instructions

The set is displayed against a cartoony airport. There's a comic in the back.

Parts

The best part of the set is the parts. You get two large plane wings, a large wheel piece, a tail fin, a propeller, and a few other useful parts. Still, 20 parts for 4 dollars isn't very good...

Minifigures

It's a cruddy pilot. He can't do that much and he doesn't really fit the part of a figure.

The build

It's boring. In fact-it's just stacking.

The completed model

It's really ugly. With just a few more parts, LEGO could have made this set a lot better-but aside from being little more than a plank with angles, the "front" is barren, and the pilot would fly off in real life. Not very safe.

Summary

I would NOT recommend this set. It's ugly. The Jack Stone theme has left it's mark-let's hope that it's never brought back.
